page.title: 03THE TORRS.
page.content: The Torrs is a sort of country park opened to the public. There are two rivers that run through the Torrs, the River Goyt and the River Sett. The River Sett runs through most of the Torrs. There is a weir that runs down to a waterwheel that used to power the Torr Vale Mill. The river flows to the east. In June l984 Dr. Millward's bridge was opened, and the centenary of Union Road Bridge was celebrated. Down the Torrs is the ruin of Torrr Mill There are steps leading down to an arched doorway, and trees are growing inside. The arched windows and walls are still there, but no roof so it is difficult to imagine how high it was. There are now benches and tables for people to have a picnic on. by Emma Peel and Heidi Cunnah..
